intro: Halophytum, commonly known as the "desert rose," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Aizoaceae. These succulent plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. They are characterized by their fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy, often pink or red, flowers that bloom in the evening. Halophytum species are adapted to survive in saline and drought-prone environments, making them popular among cactus and succulent enthusiasts. Their unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make them suitable for both indoor and outdoor cultivation.
